Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the idea isnt for us (me) to do all possible games. I am making a proof of concept of how to blockchain a deterministic random game. once that is out there, the hope is many game devs decide to launch a chain of their own

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: @jl777c does these game chains require dPoW? (of course dPoW adds additional layer of security for any chain)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: before it becomes something people can trade safely on exchanges, it would need dPoW, but just for protecting ingame gold conversions to ROGUE, it seems dPoW is overkill. even if your tx is reorged, you can just issue another one

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: https://twitter.com/NakamotoQuotes/status/1092984968823881734

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: I have a question, is the Crypto Condition Smart contract running on a side chain in Komodo Platform?

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: Yes they can be run on any assetchain of Komodo. Heres an introduction: https://komodoplatform.com/crypto-conditions-utxo-based-smart-contracts/

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: So `Asset Chains` are just really `Komodo` side chains @gcharang ?

Author: jorian#4555
Content: asset chains are completely independent blockchains

Author: jorian#4555
Content: i'll let the master speak

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: side chain has special meaning, we are making those too, but assetchains are independent and have no direct linkage to KMD.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: a lot of them notarize to KMD, but that is an independent choice

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: most of them are runtime forks

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: no source level changes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: though you can do that too, as VRSC has done

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: @jl777c thanks, so `Asset Chains` are independent blockchains,  but `Crypto Condition` smart contract runs on-chain and broadcast them to the whole `Asset chain` in the KMD ecosystem?

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: For source level changes, what if we change the `signature scheme and PoW algorithm'? Is that still doable with Asset chains?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Yes.. PoW algo can be changed like VRSC did, we use a modified VeruHash in #kmdlabs

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: CC for a specific chain is only broadcast to nodes for that specific chain

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: CC are turing complete, if you can code it, you can put it into a CC. though probably some things dont belong in a CC. certainly a new signature scheme is a perfect fit

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you can implement schnorr signatures, or shamirs secret, or whatever fancy new crypto signing method

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: each new CC is a new dedicated transaction type that must follow all the existing rules and whatever new rules you add

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: Thanks @jl777c and @blackjok3r , so I have read in the developer docs that the `Asset Chain` has a choice to leave the KMD ecosystem, but once it leaves the ecosystem, is it able to create its own Asset Chain and CC?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Yes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is open source, if you want you can fork it and maintain a new project

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Your just working with KMD code base at athat point. With #kmdlabs  we have added quite a large amount of features... but can still load and run/mign all komodo chains

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: not sure what "leave the KMD ecosystem" means specifically...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I assume that would mean changing so much copde that it no l;onger ran otehr KMD assetchains...

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if it means you wont talk to any of us here, i guess that is possible

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: or even KMD itself

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, so source level changes that breaks compatibility. certainly that is possible, but we hope that useful additions are merged back into the mainchain, like VRSC does

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content:
@jl777c  and @blackjok3r forking the project might be use a lot of time rather than creating an `Asset Chain`.
I was referring to this part https://developers.komodoplatform.com/basic-docs/start-here/outline-for-new-developers.html#the-komodo-declaration-of-independence

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: Maybe I have wrong understanding on `Move elsewhere` üò¶

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: assetchain params are very powerful, unless you wanted something very specific using them is usally enough withoug changing code. Small addition can be made by KMD ourself, which has happened in the past.

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: @blackjok3r so creating a `Asset Chain` *sample-coin* and changing the PoW and signature scheme perhaps both needs changes on C++ core level and CC?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: changint he PoW isnt trivial ... I know how to add one kind of... but its not like a plug an play option YET... if its highly demanded then its something we can add, but its a lot of work to do it properly.

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
> I was referring to this part https://developers.komodoplatform.com/basic-docs/start-here/outline-for-new-developers.html#the-komodo-declaration-of-independence

It was refering to the dPOW service

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: @gcharang I thought it was being independent on the ecosystem itself. Sorry my bad

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
There is no connection between diffrent assetchains, unless they explicitly want it. See: https://developers.komodoplatform.com/basic-docs/installations/asset-chain-parameters.html#summary-of-ac-cc

Many of the crosschain features are in the pipeline and in development
